title: Retired colonel identifies danger area for Ukraine's military
description: Retired Air Force Col. Cedric Leighton says that if Ukraine doesn't take the opportunity to withdraw from a pocket near the key city of Severodonetsk in eastern Ukraine, they risk losing a large part of their military.

title: 'Best decision': Dad goes viral for video about giving up his guns
description: Father and former Marine Ben Beers decided to surrender his handgun and AR-15 rifle to his local police station. He talks to CNN's Alisyn Camerota about his decision.

title: Prince Louis steals the show at Queen's Jubilee
description: CNN's Max Foster reports on the youngest child of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, Prince Louis, at the Queen's jubilee. During the royal flypast, the four-year-old prince had a moment on the balcony.

title: 'It was just madness inside.' Gunman kills 4 people at Tulsa hospital complex
description: Four people were killed in Tulsa on Wednesday after a gunman -- who was later found dead -- opened fire on the second floor of a medical building, authorities in Oklahoma said.

title: The hidden victims of the Nazis
description: It's Pride Month, when we celebrate the LGBTQ community's achievements and mourn its long history of oppression. But all too often this commemoration has meant remembering only gay men, who have most easily assimilated into the mainstream in recent years. The experiences of other groups, including trans people, bisexuals and lesbians, are frequently relegated to a secondary status.

title: The Match: Brady and Rodgers trash talk their way to victory over Mahomes and Allen
description: Experience trumped youth in the all-NFL quarterback edition of "the Match" on Wednesday, as Tom Brady and Aaron Rodgers defeated Josh Allen and Patrick Mahomes in Las Vegas.

title: Volodymyr Zelensky thanks Ukraine team for 'two hours of happiness' after World Cup qualifier win
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky thanked the national team for "two hours of happiness" after it produced a magical performance to beat Scotland 3-1 in its World Cup playoff semifinal on Wednesday.

title: Oil prices fall as OPEC considers pumping more to make up for Russia
description: Oil prices fell on Thursday on reports that OPEC could start to pump more crude to make up for a drop in Russian production caused by Western sanctions.

title: How Americans can watch the Queen's Platinum Jubilee
description: Queen Elizabeth II is celebrating 70 years on the throne this weekend with a busy schedule of ceremonies, parades and parties.

title: 'Essentially a ghost town': See what's it like in Beijing amid draconian Covid-19 restrictions
description: CNN's Selina Wang shows what daily life is like in Beijing, where nearly all public activity has been halted indefinitely over just a few dozen daily cases.

title: A luxury island where every room opens onto a private beach
description: Stepping off the speedboat onto the soft white sand dotted with lush tropical greenery, it might be easy to mistake this resort for Bali or the Maldives.

title: Platinum Jubilee: Your guide to the celebrations
Prince Harry and Meghan to attend Queen's birthday parade
description: Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, will attend the Queen's birthday parade on Thursday, in their first joint public appearance with the royal family since they quit as working royals two years ago.

title: Cliff diver Eleanor Smart wants to clean the world's beaches while pushing her sport to the Olympic Games
description: When professional cliff diver Eleanor Smart got her foot tangled in a plastic bag after diving into the seemingly pristine waters around Greece, it hit home that something was wrong.

title: New York's LaGuardia airport makeover revealed
description: New York officials on Wednesday, June 1 celebrated the six-year $8 billion reconstruction of the city's long-derided LaGuardia airport with a brand new Delta Air Lines terminal.

title: Alleged gang-rape of woman on moving train sparks anger in Pakistan
description: The alleged gang-rape of a woman on a moving train has sparked anger in Pakistan, putting the spotlight on the South Asian nation's poor record with women's rights.

title: Elon Musk tells Tesla employees: Return to the office, or else
description: Elon Musk is demanding that Tesla office workers return to in-person work or leave the company.

title: 'Top Gun: Maverick' brings back the Taiwan flag after controversy
description: "Top Gun: Maverick" is now showing Taiwan's official flag after outcry, putting its release in mainland China in jeopardy.

title: US lifts Cuba flight restrictions imposed under Trump
description: The administration of President Joe Biden on Wednesday revoked a series of restrictions on flights to Cuba imposed by his predecessor, including ending a prohibition on US airline flights to Cuban airports other than Havana.

title: While China makes Pacific islands tour, US Coast Guard is already on patrol
description: As China's foreign minister began a Pacific islands tour to promote economic and security cooperation with Beijing, the smallest of the US government's armed services was already on the scene, reinforcing Washington's longstanding commitment to the region.

title: 'Chicken-rice crisis' as Singapore's national dish hit by Malaysian export ban
description: Mohammad Jalehar was a teenager in the 1990s when he heard warnings about looming food and water shortages in Singapore.

title: Partner of Australian TV host detained in China expresses fears for her health
description: Concerns are growing for Australian TV host Cheng Lei, who has been detained in China for nearly two years, following an interview with her partner in which he claimed authorities had cut her access to embassy officials and tightened her food supply.

title: Tiny island nations at the center of giant geopolitical rivalry
description: Tiny, impoverished Pacific Island nations have become the focus of intense diplomatic activity from China, as Beijing's top diplomat wraps up an island-hopping tour of at least eight countries. CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

title: Canada: Chinese warplanes are buzzing our North Korea reconnaissance flights
description: • Analysis: China has the power to take Taiwan, but it would cost an extremely bloody price

title: Biggest moments from Queen Elizabeth 70 years on the throne
description: As UK's Queen Elizabeth II celebrates her Platinum Jubilee, as the longest serving British monarch in history, CNN's Max Foster takes a look back at Her Majesty's 70 years of reign.

title: Biden looks powerless as crises crest around him
description: Joe Biden is right that presidents can't just click their fingers and fix things. But for his political prospects, he might have been best not saying so out loud.

title: 'I survived two sandstorms and nearly ran out of water in the Sahara Desert,' says man who biked from London to Lagos
description: Kunle Adeyanju is a self-confessed daredevil who has climbed Mount Kilimanjaro twice and cycled from Lagos to Accra over three days.

title: Former Dallas Cowboys running back Marion Barber has died at age 38
description: Running back Marion Barber III, who spent most of his NFL career with the Dallas Cowboys, has died at the age of 38, the team said Wednesday.

title: He helped decode texts from January 6th. What he found scared him
description: Denver Riggleman, a former Republican congressman who helped the January 6 committee link text messages sent to and from Trump White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows, tells CNN's Anderson Cooper what scared him about what he uncovered about the January 6 insurrection.

title: What if airplanes were wider? Plane interior concept re-imagines inflight seating
description: You might not know that the standard for today's airline seat sizing goes all the way back to 1954.

title: Legal victory for Johnny Depp after he and Amber Heard found liable for defamation
Biden administration cancels $5.8 billion in student loan debt for former Corinthian students
description: The Department of Education announced Wednesday that it will cancel $5.8 billion in student loan debt for 560,000 borrowers who attended the now-defunct network of for-profit schools known as Corinthian Colleges.
